website_summaries.verdict: The gold standard in Cuisinart mixers if you want a workhorse.
pros: All combine to create the best stand mixer from Cuisinart
cons: At 24 pounds, it is virtually immovable

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: I Have been wrestling for the past 6 months researching to find the best reasonably priced stand mixer. For the money the Cuisinart SM55 mixer has all the features I need. I needed a High watt mixer that has enough power to mix heavy bread and pizza dough. This mixer has an 800 watt motor, 225 more watts than the top of the line home Kitchenaid mixer at half the price, 3 year warranty, 5 year on the motor. Have made several batches of dough, this mixer performed flawlessly, more than enough power.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: It would be a waste to try the other attachments available
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself for a birthday gift. I have used it for about six weeks. It's an attractive mixer and it works okay. But I purchased this brand because it had attachments I could purchase. The blender and food processor have no power. It would be a waste to try the other attachments available. Very disappointed. And when I mix a thick batter for cookies the mixer tends to shake or jump around. So, I don't feel safe leaving it unattended. It might work its way off the counter. It does not meet my expectations of a multi purpose stand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: pinkirish

customer_reviews.title: Did not last 45 days!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mixer on March 5, 2016 and today is April 26, 2016. My mixer was purchased brand new.I use it at least 3 times per week. On 4-25-16, I used it to make bread. It made a funny sound the entire time I was kneading and then it overheated an shut off. I own MANY Cuisinart products and I am so very sad that this one is overheating with a simple dough making recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Sauerdoc

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stand mixer! Quiet, powerful, and short enough to slide into the cupboard. We’ve had this mixer for several years now, and never had any problems with it making cakes, cookies, and breads.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Attachment stuck and wont come out after inly a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning it. After using it only a few times one of the attachments is stuck in it and won't come out. We've tried everything. I wish it wouldn't have done that because other than that it is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: M. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Oil dirping to dough mixture
customer_reviews.text: There was oil spill around the attachment connector. Dough always raise to the top and stick around the connector (accessory power port). Noticed oil residues on the Dough first time but cleaned, it happens in every dough after that. Power wise seems ok, still shaking when the dough is too tick. It seems better that the model 600.
customer_reviews.author: SKA (IL USA)

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer, accessories need help
customer_reviews.text: We've had the mixer for two years now and wanted to share our observations. First, the mixer has been solid. The timer is great, it is very stable and powerful. In hindsight, wished we purchased the 7qt, but my wife can still do enough dough for 2 loaves at one time with this one. The biggest gripe has been the accessories. The mixing paddle and dough hook both have a finish that come off after just a bit of use (presumably in the food). Cuisinart support has replaced them both a number of times. Finally bailed and purchased an after-market mixing paddle - still looking for an after market dough hook.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nadig

customer_reviews.title: I actually like it better than my Kitchenaid (which I gave to ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually like it better than my Kitchenaid (which I gave to a niece after receiving this). I like the timer most. I like the shield least as I find it somewhat awkward when trying to fit.
customer_reviews.author: B.Davis

customer_reviews.title: We bought it because of the 800Watt motor and our love of home baked bread.
customer_reviews.text: Still somewhat untried because it's summer and we haven't made bread yet, but what we've done with it so far has shown it to be exactly what was advertised. We bought it because of the 800Watt motor and our love of home baked bread, but that won't happen until fall. Easy to setup and use. Truly a "desktop" because of weight, but it doesn't seem to "walk" when it's in use. Very quiet. Given the larger motor and no plastic gear it's a no brainer to go with this compared to the KitchenAid which broke when a metal gear stripped. Add on: Have owned it for about a year. Still think it's 5-star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, and I love it. Heavy, really does dough well. Made dinner rolls with it for thanksgiving and it didn't bat an eye lash. Love the all mental, and I hope that this lasts for years to come. Its really nice to look at as well. Dont mind keeping it on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kurz

customer_reviews.title: Good performance w less promise?
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used the mixer twice and so far so good. I don’t know whether that will continue however; just notice the nameplate was missing. Apparently the sticky tape Cuisineart uses to hold on the plastic piece doesn’t hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn L.

customer_reviews.title: Best stand mixer I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this stand mixer. Very powerful but has an awesome fold feature that doesn't fling dry ingredients everywhere. Cannot beat the out of the box warranty on a Cuisinart. My only negative is no attachments will work for the hub on this mixer so I'm disappointed about that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 14 months. No customer support from Cusinart or Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I barely used this machine. I had it on hand for holiday baking, special occassions, and the odd times we baked brownies so no heavy use here. I bought this September 2018. Completely dead. Checked all outlets, breakers, etc. and it's the machine itself that isn't working. Tried contacting both manufacturer and amazon. Nothing. No response from Cusinart after being put on a very long hold. Talked with a customer service expert from Cusinart who dropped the phone call. Awesomely awful. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: L H.

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: i had originally ordered a Kitchenaid through BestBuy. They mucked up the order and couldn't make my required delivery date so I cancelled. Talked to a friend who is a real baker and she raved about her Cuisinart so I figured I would buck the Kitchenaid trend. Glad I did. My Cuisinart is simply wonderful. Easy to use, sleek, pretty quiet for the motor size and a breeze to clean. I puchased the silver/chrome model. I've done heavy fruit cakes, bread dough, packet cakes all came out well. I actually make up reasons to use it because it is so much fun to use. A winner.
customer_reviews.author: AnneH

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for 7 years and it’s still going strong
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: The motor is fine but all the plastic bits fail
customer_reviews.text: The food processor attachment is so loud I need to ware hearing protection! The processor brakes with very little use I am on my third one! The knob used to raise the mixer head broke. The motor is fine but all the plastic bits fail. If only the product was a bit better made it would be usable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my new mixer
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer. It is well made and has great extra features. It will handle everything from breads to delicate pastries and meringues. I love the timer feature that automatically stops mixing, great for kneading tasks. It also has a setting for gently folding in ingredients. I have made several bread recipes with this mixer and it has never had a problem with overheating or labouring and it does not dance around the counter under a heavy load. I do wish it had a longer power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Morgana J. Meverden

customer_reviews.title: Functional AND pretty to look at! So happy
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer sooooooo much! It’s so functional and it’s pretty to look at as well!! It’s replacing my Kenwood that I had for 25 years! Very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been making cookies for almost a year using this wonderful stand mixer. I should have gotten one years ago but didn't. Now I wonder why not. I have always mixed cookies by hand, even one recipe that calls for eleven cups of flour! Now I can mix a batch of cookies in no time with this mixer. I made almost fifty seven dozen Christmas cookies in the last week and had no trouble at all. Some of the dough was very stiff, but I stay on the lowest speed and this mixer does all the work. I would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: My New Bae!!
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd be that person that raved about an appliance.....I AM SO IN LOVE! This product is amazing! I have a cookie business and this thing is so smooth and perfect that I don't even know how I lived without it before!!! A must purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: One of Many People

customer_reviews.title: Cusinart Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mixer after my old Braun's dough hook broke off in the head of my mixer. It was a wedding gift and only 23 yrs old! I was concerned at what to by for a replacement and choose this model. I like it fine only I cannot mix up 4 loaves of bread at a time and am quite disappointed and I guess I should have bought the larger model.That is my fault not the companies. I have since cut my recipe in half and carry on baking. I have made cakes, cookies and bread since my purchase a month ago. It has lots of power and is easy to use. I would recommend this mixer to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: P.S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, though the bowl doesn't seem to lock ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, though the bowl doesn't seem to lock into place, it's likely user error as I was in a rush the one time I've used it so far. I bought the blender attachment and use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Completely Honest

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit
customer_reviews.text: We plugged the unit in to be sure it worked and everything was fine. Went to actually go use it and nothing would power up. Tried multiple outlets and the unit showed no sign of life. Tried troubleshooting in the owners manual to no avail. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer, very well built
customer_reviews.text: I have always had cheap mixers and they would either crap out in a couple of years or would either bog down when mixing heavy cookie dough or sling flour everywhere when mixing bread or cake mixes. This mixer has the power plus the deep mixing bowl and splash guard makes mixing a much neater activity. I considered a Kitchenaid but the 3 year warranty plus Black Friday pricing reeled me in. I have mixed and baked at least 6 different kinds of cookie dough for the holidays just today and am very impressed...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pope

customer_reviews.title: The perfect mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for any kitchen if you cook 'real food'. This mixer does it all and does not bog down. It is easy to use, easy to clean and does not 'wobble' around on the counter even when kneading bread dough. It does not overheat as the motor is heavy duty unlike the competition. The timer is handy as well. This is the perfect mixer because of its strong motor, ease of use & cleanup and it is stylish too if it sits out on your counter. I highly recommend this mixer and I am a grandmother who cooks a LOT.
customer_reviews.author: mrs wizard

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy this mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by Cooks Illustrated is what got my attention. But as I read other evaluations and saw one for myself I became ready to buy. Have made a number of different dishes. Meat loaf, biscuits, cookies, cakes, mashed potatos, etc. I really like the timer and the slow start feature before it comes up to full speed at what speed you have chosen. Wondered whether I should have purchased the larger capacity one, but this one has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Notes from Milwaukie

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I was close to buying the KitchenAid brand, but after a lot of research, I bought this CuisinArt, as it has much better ratings (check out Consumer Reports). The warranty is much better too. The mixer is very sturdy and heavy, you can turn it on and you don't need to hold it - it does not wobble. The attachments are metallic, which is a plus, considering the other brands have plastic attachments. It also has a timer and a "Fold" option button.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Girl

customer_reviews.title: excellent buy & machine.
customer_reviews.text: what an arm saver. All of us made pepper nut cookies with this unit. Let me tell you pepper nuts are just as hard to make as bread dough is. Try it by hand one time & you will agree with me. The machine to start to heat up one time & it did shut down automatically. After a few minutes I slowed down the speed, & it never overheated again. Other machines such as kitchen aides Also, shut down. Except in their case they usually shut down permentaly. This machines works as promised, & than some.
customer_reviews.author: jack wolpa

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen must.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. Saves kitchen space, now that I can get rid of blender and chopper.
customer_reviews.author: Lezlie Marot

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I can't say too many nice things about this unit. It's flexible (multi-speed, multi-whisk), powerful, and the bowl is large enough to accommodate most domestic usages. I've used mine a great deal since acquiring it and so far it's been totally trouble-free. It's also easy to clean, which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Allan M. Lees

customer_reviews.title: Worth the exta money
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent machine. It is heavy enough to stay in place while mixing. High quality construction and powerful motor.
customer_reviews.author: GregB

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife as a replacement, she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice mixer. Well made. Works great, and I suspect it will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I really don't bother to write up a review so just the fact that I'm taking the time to do this speaks volumes. I did the research before buying this product. It was number one on the Cooks Illustrated list. It was also highly recommended by Good Housekeeping It is especially recommended for kneading doughs which I do a lot of. Solid and sturdy. Easy clean up. You can leave it to run while you do the washing up, bathe the baby, tidy up. And with Amazon Prime I received the product in a matter of days. I enjoyed every single part of getting this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Bain

customer_reviews.title: top notch
customer_reviews.text: after looking at a variety of reviews I decided to buy this model. Here's why: 1. very powerful motor (800 compared to 400 of other makes) 2. with added attachments could be the complete kitchen-do-everything machine 3. spout on lid of bowl makes it easy to add while mixing. (I am very clumsy!) 4. large capacity bowl with a handle on side (clumsy me again) 5. Price: retail was $550.00 but found it on Amazon with a comparative price to my #2 choice (Kitchen Aid) That made the decision for me...Got it at $269.00 and no shipping charges. I'm extremely pleased with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: retired teacher

customer_reviews.title: We have switched Teams...Kitchen Aid to Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.text: My family has been using Kitchen Aid mixers for years. But when Hobart sold Kitchen Aid off a couple of years ago, you could see and hear the quality drop off. I will not spend a couple hundred dollars on a machine that has plastic gears. I bought this Cuisinart 5 1/2 quart mixer for my wife as a surprise. She has fallen in love with it. She originally wanted the Kitchen Aid mixer because of all the great things family had said. After I'd done my due diligence and researched the hell out of these things, I made my choice. And I'm converting all of our family and friends as their Kitchen Aid mixers die off.
customer_reviews.author: NWMike

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a four star (although maybe not totally justified) due to its heavy weight...a young person will not be bothered by this, but being a senior citizen with arthritis, it does become a problem...it is lovely to look at and a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: frankie

customer_reviews.title: The mixer works ok, and the rated capacity is misleading
customer_reviews.text: This mixer operates easily, with one problem. I use it mostly to make cookies and cakes. Everything works well. The problem I have involves the bowl capacity. Its rated at 5.5 qts , but 5.5 qts fills the bowl right up to the rim, hardly useful for mixing. Also the bowl shape limits the amount of batter/dough I can mix. My 5 qt Kitchenaid mixer has more usable capacity This unit works very well mixing smaller amounts, but larger batches call for a different mixer.
customer_reviews.author: ralph silva

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart is an awesome company to buy from. I now own 4 big ticket appliances from them and, am completely satisfied. This mixer replaces the kitchenaid mixer that after a few years of ownership has started to break down. I decided on cuisinart after owning their food processor for over 11 years(an still running). I wanted to upgrade to stainless. Now all my appliances match and are cuisinart. A very smart investment if I do say so myself. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Not good as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Got broke with in 3 months of use. Contacted the cuisinart and they agreed to repair them for free of charge. Great customer service. But not a reliable product with my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Nimidu Gmalath

customer_reviews.title: good features and function but the hinge should latch more tightly
customer_reviews.text: Very good features and function but the hinge should latch more tightly and firmly. The motor-mixer assembly moves considerably when mixing a single load of bread. I am concerned that the hinge assembly will not hold up for more than 50 loaves. Will update soon.
customer_reviews.author: sometimes savy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mixer!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love my Cuisinart 12-Speed Stand Mixer. I wish I had gotten it years ago. I love how you can set the timer and do other things while it's doing its job. It is so easy to use. I debated between it and another brand and I am soooo glad I chose this one. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as a gift for my wife. She really enjoys baking and the Whisk in the spoons and the stirring was a lot of work this product eliminates all that work.
customer_reviews.author: Moses

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a stand mixer so bad. After doing research
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a stand mixer so bad. After doing research, I saw that this one was just as good as Kitchen Aid. It's a wonderful machine. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: CMC73

customer_reviews.title: The large sized bowl makes it very easy to blend ingredients together without making a mess when ...
customer_reviews.text: The large sized bowl makes it very easy to blend ingredients together without making a mess when it starts to mix. The extra speed settings make it easy to blend at speed that doesn't overwork the dough when making bread.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Tunstall

customer_reviews.title: Bread Makers Beware
customer_reviews.text: I make bread a couple of times a week, and needed a sturdy mixer. My previous KitchenAid failed miserably. The Cuisinart lasted a couple of years, but then one day the attachment could not be removed. We were unable to find anyone who could remove it or fix the mixer. So we purchased another Cuisinart, hoping that this one would last. This time, little more than a year of use, the attachment cannot be inserted. If you're looking for a stand mixer capable of regular bread dough kneading look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Noisier than my juicer!
customer_reviews.text: Which is 200 more watts. Only complaint is that it sounds like a jet taking off. Works great and better design than the Kitchen Aide. Made bread, cookies, whipped cream and cupcakes so far!
customer_reviews.author: R. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the first mixer of any kind that I have owned and I love it. I've been using it for over a year now and it works great. I use it once or twice a week for making bread dough. I've also used it for making cookies, cakes and pancake batter. It's easy to use, cleans up easily and the timer is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Desjardins

customer_reviews.title: The industry standard, IMO
customer_reviews.text: When I was researching stand mixers three years ago, I thought Kitchenaid would be the winner. Fortunately, I referred to America's Test Kitchen and was surprised to see the Cuisinart as the winner. I convinced my husband to let me pony up the money, and it's been money well-spent. Mashed potatoes, cheesecakes, cake batter, pumpkin pie... my mixer stays busy through the holidays. My only issue is with the attachments- they fall off fairly easily. I've learned to anticipate it, so no more beaters in the batter. But it is a little frustrating. Overall, it does just what it's supposed to, and looks beautiful to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Je lis

customer_reviews.title: Trying something new
customer_reviews.text: My husband has actually taken the mixer over! Read reviews before purchasing and so far has lived up to the hype. My husband is very destructive and the mixer has survived him.
customer_reviews.author: sara gibbs

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: this is the first stand mixer I ever purchased, and I did a lot of research on line, it's very easy to use and clean up is great and the ease of using the mixer is great,I csn actually double my bread recipe, love the time it saves me from not having to do so much mixing of the bread dough with my hand mixer, because it is a very dense dough, I would reccomend it to anyone who loves to bake. Bellinda Anderson
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My best friend on the kitchen. When you make plan to buy a stand mixer-buy Cuisinart .Oh,my...I just love it. I try to work with Kitchen Aid,and return back to store. Cuisinart more comfortable for me. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Olga M

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Mixer
customer_reviews.text: The mixer is very powerful! You do not even need to use it all to properly mix breads and thick doughs. It is also very sturdy, as it does not rock or shake when handling high torque or power situations. It is also extremely easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves her mixer. Very solid and powerful. No problems with it at all. Doesn't wobble. Great purchase. Only had it about 3 weeks but am looking forward to years of usage!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Am really happy with this product, d that I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Hope

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performer
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with my Cuisinart Mixer. I have just started making bread from scratch and this machine has made the process a whole lot easier for me. Made pie crust with ease and will try this weekend to make a complicated cake frosting from 'the olden days' that requires 10 minutes of beating. The timer should be a big help with that. All in all I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: cuisinart mixer
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying my new mixer. It is powerful, dependable, and well built. It has enabled me to successfully complete all my Christmas baking needs in good time which my other mixer would not allow me to do. It is not flimsy and it's style and colour will compliment all of my other appliances no matter what the fasion colour of the year! I have never owned a cuisinart appliance before, but can strongly recommend this one and will look closely at other prpoducts from now on.
customer_reviews.author: fiona

customer_reviews.title: Get this!!
customer_reviews.text: Much more powerful than kitchen aid and great quality! There is nothing this machine can't do and I love the easy start and timer just makes it all the better it's pricey I know but once you make a decision to get a stand mixer you really want the best. Excellent purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie galbo

customer_reviews.title: wonderful machine
customer_reviews.text: I love the speed and power of this machine and the attachments are awesome. I would recommend this machine to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving my new mixer and bragging to everyone about it. I am so glad I researched stand mixers before buying the Kitchen Aide Mixer. When I read all the complaints for the Kitchen Aide and the cost was pretty high I looked around and found the Cuisinart stand mixer and it had more and better featchers plus the warranty was much better and it cost less. We decided to get this one and it was a very good choice.
customer_reviews.author: sherol white

customer_reviews.title: a great mixer
customer_reviews.text: I use the mixer for bread. I don't have to babysit the mixer to make sure it does not shake off the counter. The arm has not been shaking either. Our previous mixer was a kitchenaid and I would have to hold it in place as it constantly moved. We replaced this mixer because the arm loosened up so much that the dough hook started hitting the sides of the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: I researched several brands of stand mixers and Cuisinart seemed to be the best value. I'm very pleased with the mixer. I like the versatility the attachments give to the system. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hutcherson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: We use this Cuisinart SM-55BK 5-1/2-Quart 12-Speed Stand Mixer, in black, every week. Awesome quality, which is what I expect from a Cuisinart product!
customer_reviews.author: Why not?

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart ...what can I say!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing as is all Cuisinart appliances I own...always consistent never a disappointment ...look forward to using because end results always amazing and again consistent
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis L. Schroder

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Mixer Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Having struggled along with another mixer for several years as it became louder and louder, I decided it was time for a change. Glowing online reviews of the Cuisinart and an excellent price from Amazon.com led me to purchase one. So far it's lighter to move around, quieter by far, and twice as strong as my old machine. The non-stick paddle and bread hook are a joy to work with. I hope it wears as well as it works initially.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing, mixes well, looks nice in the kitchen, and the timer feature is wonderful. So easy to use that my four year old son can use it!
customer_reviews.author: lady lawyer

customer_reviews.title: Best mixer ever
customer_reviews.text: I used my new mixer for holiday baking. It was incredible. I became a baking machine with family and friends reaping the benefits. No one could believe the number of different cookies I made. My cuisinart mixer made it so easy and enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Jayedee

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I call it my extra helper. You could also attach a food processor, blender, meat grinder, citrus juicer and pasta maker at the top and the front. These accessories are sold separately, but its there when you want an all-in-one. It has a timer, with a variety of speed levels. My friend has a KitchenAid, and I used hers, but definitely was missing mine. I decided to purchase this mixer because it was a recommended mixer over the KitchenAid in America's Test Kitchen magazine.
customer_reviews.author: Nique-health guru

customer_reviews.title: Love this mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I burned through a couple hand mixers and one stand mixer before finding this one. Nice big motor, bottom grips help it stay put on the counter, makes all the divinity fudge I can give away with no problem! Great value for the price. Can't go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.author: jch

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I waited for nearly a year for this mixer to go on sale and once it did, I jumped on it. It was well worth the wait. It's been great for mixing everything from cake batter to dough. I would definitely recommend this product for a Christmas present or a wedding gift. My only regret is that I didn't buy one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Nay 3

customer_reviews.title: great mixer
customer_reviews.text: i have used this since 2009..i mainly mix cookies and bread dough..i can get 6 or 7 med size loaves of bread in one recipe, the bowl is a good size,,great for any mixing, whip cream to dough ..this is a work horse..iv had 2 of the other name brand mixer and each lasted one year and the bowl was small..luv this machine!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline rappach

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. My only reason for not giving it five stars is that its a bit noisier (louder) than the Kitchen Aid brand.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: After having a Kitchenaid and Breville - this Cuisinart Stand Mixer has been my favorite by far. It's a little noisey would be the only issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer only one tiny flaw
customer_reviews.text: Great Mixer only one tiny flaw, lets be honest with ourselves no one uses the the little clear cover that they give you with the mixer because its a pain. and when you don't use that, the shape of the mixer have a cup on top that catches the stuff you put inside. so with that out of the way, this this is great! Everything else about it perfect. Buy it you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Mirza

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year I am still thrilled with this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer a year ago with Christmas money. I went on line to buy a Kitchen Aid and after reading reviews and thinking it over for a few days I decided on the Cuisanart, I have used is many many times and have nothing but praise. I love everything from the compact shape to it's functions. I would reccomend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Sipher

customer_reviews.title: So far, Me love it up...
customer_reviews.text: Done the job every time, efficient and easy to use and clean. I am a chef and this is one of the best mixers I have used over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Rochell

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: Dissapointing for a Cuisinart product. Did not do a very good job of mixing ingredients Loud motor Rubber pad on bottom of mixer would come off and mixer would wobble Would not recommend this mixer
customer_reviews.author: GJS

customer_reviews.title: Wow, it's like a helping hand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Mixer as a present for a friend who loves baking. I did buy it, because her old hand mixer broke. And she wrote to me: I had to get used to it, but then, WOW, it's like a helping hand in the kitchen and I can start to think bigger. She really loves that Cuisinart Stand Mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Feigenwinter

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the cuisinart mixer, it is heavy duty and i like the 12 speed dial, and the option to attached other food processor on top of this mixer
customer_reviews.author: wanda

customer_reviews.title: I love this mixture
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer along time ago. Years ago.I always wanted to write a review. So I am. I love this mixture. What I wanted to do before I bought it was to see it in a store. I found out that this brand of mixer wasn't sold in all stores. I had to find one and I did. This mixer isn't out in stores and should be.. It isn't as bulky as the kitchenaid. Fits on my counter and stores in my cabinet. This mixer works great I have made bread to whip cream always preforms great..
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Love my Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: Have always owned KitchenAid but decided to try Cuisinart as I have several other of their products. I love this. Like the size, the performance is great. Would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: bunny30

customer_reviews.title: Best product in its category for its price
customer_reviews.text: Finishing first, bool very comfortable, and perfect for kneading bread dough to 1-2 lbs. It seems to me that likes the work of pastry. For its price I think it is an excellent product. Hope you have a good performance and is durable .. time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Pessolano

customer_reviews.title: I love
customer_reviews.text: this blender is great, I love it, it's all I wanted to make cakes, breads, cookies, buttercream and more
customer_reviews.author: Adriana V.

customer_reviews.title: Love this mixer
customer_reviews.text: Amazing mixer! Love everything about it! I've begun baking something new and different every weekend and have nothing but good things to say about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Love the warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to work up a batch of whole wheat bread yet but it has performed excellent on cookies and was much quieter than my very noisy and now dead (2 months after warranty) KA600. Also love the 5 yr warranty!
customer_reviews.author: allona fay

customer_reviews.title: great mixer but...
customer_reviews.text: I really love the lighter weight (compared to Kitchenaid) and have had great results with double batch cookies. It works wonderfully well. However, for a right handed person used to adding ingredients with my dominant hand, the controls are on the wrong side of the mixer ??!!. I've adapted and face the mixer forward so I can get to the the release handle, on-off switch and speed control dial with my right hand but I'd really prefer to have the bowl facing to the right so it's easier to use. I was also a bit disappointed that the bowl was too tall to fit into my refrigerator--when I need to chill before baking.
customer_reviews.author: sulynnew

customer_reviews.title: Bread hook jams into appliance
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to purchase this, be sure to have a 15mm thin wrench. You will need it to remove the bread hook. As the machine kneads the dough, the nut on the attachment tightens. The plastic splashguard to protect the nut and shaft from getting dirty also makes it really difficult to use a normal wrench to loosen the nut. A really poor design. The Cuisinart staff was totally unhelpful. As someone else stated, the warranty is useless, mail in service only and user pays shipping both ways. This thing is huge and would cost a fortune to ship.
customer_reviews.author: Steen

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing, but controls could use an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Would get four stars if the speed control didn't feel so flimsy. There aren't any physical cues that you have reached a given speed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: Love it ! It's a work horse but doesn't weigh a ton to move around the counter.I especially like the lag in speed when you restart after adding ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Perry

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I received processor as a belated Christmas gift from my husband-he did not know he got it for me :) Anyway, he likes it almost as much as I do. Everyweekend I make cookies and bread. They are so easy and enjoyable to mix with my cruisinart. I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Marty in Greensboro, NC

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mixer, the handle on the bowl is perfect!! I would recommend to everyone. Makes baking fast and easy!!! Love it
customer_reviews.author: KLN

customer_reviews.title: I love it. When I tell my KitchenAid user friends ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. When I tell my KitchenAid user friends about how useful the timer is, their answer was, "What they have a timer?" Most people think KitchenAid, After much research, I chose this one. It is more powerful (800 Watt), has a timer that I found so useful and much cheaper. Most people saw this mixer and guested a much higher price. It is a gem.
customer_reviews.author: ConeyIsland

customer_reviews.title: shocking mixer
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our mixer 4 1/2 years ago, in Dec 2008. I don't use it as much as I'd like too, but it works when I use it. I would have given it 4 or 5 stars. Unfortunately, after using it to whip cream last week the mixer now shocks anyone who touches the bowl or the silver band around the top of the machine. It doesn't have to be running to shock the user, it only has to be plugged in. The shock is strong--it is not a minor static-type shock. The warranty is for 3-years, so that is that.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: cuisinart sm-55bc 5 1/2 quart
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product in the past and loved it. This time I ordered it, it came without any instructions, warranty info, and the top didn't sit on it right. Looks like it was a return item and it was passed to me as new. Not happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: jhg

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Is everything I expected from Cuisinart. Easy to use and clean. Great product. Not noisy. Would recommend this Stand mixer to anyone who likes to bake.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jones

customer_reviews.title: This mixer is so much better than our kitchen aid
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is so much better than our kitchen aid. When mixing stiff doughs this mixer does not jump and labor as the other one did. The slow start eliminated the flour dust from the mixer and counter. Best mixer we have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: It is incredible and is works so great. Wish I had bought it years ago when my Kitchen Aid first started acting up. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Annette Guadagnin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with my mixer!!!!!! My last mixer leaked oil constantly and this brand I love. I even like the timer, the way it mixes , love love love it. I purchased it at Amazon.com & it was here in days.
customer_reviews.author: Merial J. Usher

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I loved it. It is the best on the market. I wished if they selling them locally on my city, but for some reason the are selling only KitchenAid. It has been more than 1 year using without any problem. Recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Raid

customer_reviews.title: This is a BLACK BEAUTY!
customer_reviews.text: I love using my new Cuisinart stand mixer. It make making bread so much easier. And, the machine is easy to clean after using. I call It my Black Beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Rustyroses

product_meta.title: Cuisinart SM-55BK 5-1/2-Quart 12-Speed Stand Mixer, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackHoused in durable die-cast metal, this stand mixer features a powerful 800-watt motor that can handle the heaviest mixing tasks. Its large, 5-1/2-quart, stainless-steel bowl accommodates big batches--even double recipes. The unit also provides 12 mixing speeds, along with a 15-minute countdown timer and automatic shutoff, for maximum precision. Choose the slow-start function to eliminate splatter or the ultra-gentle fold function to carefully blend in delicate ingredients. The mixer's tilt-back head allows for easy access to the mixing bowl and makes attaching accessories simple. 

 Accessories include a chef's whisk, a flat mixing paddle, and a dough hook, as well as a splashguard. The whisk aerates ingredients to increase volume or can also be used on slow speed to gently combine dry ingredients. Contoured to reach the bottom and sides of the bowl, the flat mixing paddle ensures thorough mixing. The dough hook makes hand kneading obsolete, while the splashguard offers an extra-wide pouring spout for easily adding ingredients. The stand mixer also contains three power outlets, including a high-speed outlet for its optional dedicated attachments (meat grinder, citrus juicer, blender, food processor, or pasta maker--all sold separately). The stand mixer measures 15-1/2 by 10 by 12-1/2 inches and carries a three-year product warranty and a five-year motor warranty. 

 From the Manufacturer

 

More than 30 years ago, Cuisinart changed the way the world cooked. Now it's changing the way the world mixes with the Cuisinart stand mixer. The new extra-large Cuisinart 5-quart mixer has the power, capacity, and precision to handle any job a recipe requires and delivers more power to mix even the heaviest dough. There’s also more capacity to double and triple recipes. The mixer comes with three accessories, allowing you to mix, whip, or even knead dough. It has 12 speeds to ensure splatter-free starts and fabulous finishes. In addition, Cuisinart offers optional attachments that can be purchased separately. Each attachment connects to one of the three power outlets on the mixer (two on the top and one on the front) to let you blend, process food, squeeze juice from your favorite citrus fruits, make homemade pasta, or grind your own meats.  Multiple Outlets Mean More Functionality 

 

 

 1. High-speed power outlet for the blender and food processor attachment (sold separately), which connects to the rear power outlet on top of the stand mixer. 
 2. Mid-speed power outlet for the citrus juicer attachment (sold separately), which connects to the front power outlet on the top of the stand mixer. 
 3. Slow-speed power outlet for the large meat grinder and the pasta maker attachments (sold separately), which connect to the power outlet behind the slow-speed outlet cover on the front of the stand mixer head. 

 An Array of Helpful Features

 

The mixer's tilt-back head securely locks the stand mixer into a raised position, which allows easy access to the 5-quart mixing bowl and makes it easy to attach accessories. The stainless-steel bowl includes handles, which makes the bowl easy to hold, scrape, and remove, and it's oversized to let you mix larger quantities.  The mixer has a handy 15-minute countdown timer as well as a slow-start function that eliminates splatter for the most delicate ingredients. The fold function allows you to mix in ingredients at the lowest speed with two options--continuous, to blend ingredients, and pulse, to combine ingredients. Each pulse generates 1-1/2 to 2-1/2 revolutions of the flat mixing paddle, chef's whisk, or dough hook. The flat mixing paddle, dough hook, or chef's whisk spins independently while rotating around the mixing bowl for the quickest, most thorough results. No need to rotate the mixing bowl, Cuisinart’s stand mixer does all the work for you. 

 Features:

 

 *  Large 5-quart-capacity polished stainless-steel bowl 
 *  Powerful 800-watt motor 
 *  15-minute countdown timer 
 *  Auto shutoff and 12 speeds 
 *  Includes 3 accessories: chef's whisk, flat mixing paddle, dough hook 
 *  Splashguard with pour spout to prevent spattering 
 *  Recipe book 
 *  Power unit: clean with a damp cloth and dry 
 *  Bowls and tools dishwasher-safe (tools top-rack dishwasher-safe) 
 *  Warranty: Limited 3-year product warranty and a full 5-year motor warranty
feature_bullets: 800-watt stand mixer housed in durable die-cast metal
12 speeds; 5-1/2-quart stainless-steel bowl; slow-start and gentle-fold functions
15-minute countdown timer; 3 power outlets; auto shutoff; tilt-back head
Chef's whisk, flat mixing paddle, dough hook, and splashguard included
Product Built to North American Electrical Standards
